intro: Ornitrophe triandra, commonly known as the golden orchid, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It is characterized by its striking yellow petals and delicate, fragrant blooms. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as rainforests. Its roots are fibrous and help it anchor in rich, organic soil. Ornitrophe triandra is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and botanical collections.
